properties.Title: Snow Squall Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Locally heavy snow squalls possible today. locally heavy snow squalls are expected to begin this morning continue through the day. Snow squalls are expected to taper off in the afternoon. Local snowfall amounts of 15 to 20 cm in 12 hours are possible. ### Snow squalls cause weather conditions to vary considerably; changes from clear skies to heavy snow within just a few kilometres are common. Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become difficult to navigate due to accumulating snow. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2021-01-29T20:02:34-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-29T09:42:34-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2558954536.2021
Area: Watford - Pinery Park - Eastern Lambton County, Strathroy - Komoka - Western Middlesex County
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snow Squall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Locally heavy snow squalls continue this morning. Locally heavy snow squalls will continue this morning before tapering off near noon. Snow squalls are expected to drift south into Western Middlesex and Eastern Lambton later this morning. Local snowfall amounts of 15 to 20 cm in 12 hours are possible. ### Snow squalls cause weather conditions to vary considerably; changes from clear skies to heavy snow within just a few kilometres are common. Visibility will be suddenly reduced to near zero at times in heavy snow and blowing snow. Travel is expected to be hazardous due to reduced visibility in some locations. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2021-01-29T16:34:41-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-29T09:41:41-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3064965878.2021
Area: London - Parkhill - Eastern Middlesex County, Wingham - Blyth - Northern Huron County, Goderich - Bluewater - Southern Huron County
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snow Squall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:

Local snowfall amounts of 15 to 20 cm in 12 hours are possible. ### Visibility will be suddenly reduced to near zero at times in heavy snow and blowing snow. Travel is expected to be hazardous due to reduced visibility in some locations. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.

properties.Title: Blowing Snow Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Poor visibility in snow and blowing snow is expected or occurring in some locations. ### Travel is expected to be hazardous due to reduced visibility. Blowing snow advisories are issued when winds are expected to create blowing snow giving poor visibility to 800 metres or less for at least 3 hours. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2021-01-30T01:47:41-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-29T09:47:41-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1563293109.2021

properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Extreme Cold Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Extremely cold wind chill values near -50 are expected tonight into Friday morning. Temperatures are expected to moderate through the day Friday, but could reach -50 again overnight into Saturday. ### Extreme cold warnings are issued when very cold temperatures or wind chill creates an elevated risk to health such as frost bite and hypothermia. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NTStorm.
Expires: 2021-01-29T20:18:23-00:00

properties.Title: Extreme Cold Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Extreme wind chill values near minus 40 this morning. ### Watch for cold related symptoms: shortness of breath, chest pain, muscle pain and weakness, numbness and colour change in fingers and toes. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.

properties.Title: Winter Storm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Hazardous winter conditions are expected. Total snowfall: 15 to 20 cm. Maximum wind gusts: northwest to north 60 to 70 km/h. Locations: Postville - Makkovik. Time span: early Saturday morning until Saturday evening. Remarks: Snow will begin in the early-morning hours of Saturday and will continue, at times heavy, throughout the day. This snow will be accompanied by moderate to strong northerly winds, which will significantly reduce visibility in snow and blowing snow. Conditions are expected to improve Saturday evening. ### Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Winter storm warnings are issued when multiple types of severe winter weather are expected to occur together. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2021-01-30T06:32:07-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-29T14:33:07-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0522550867.2021
Area: Postville - Makkovik
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snow Squall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snow squalls are occurring. Under the snow squall bands, visibilities will be significantly reduced due to the heavy snow, and snow will quickly accumulate. Snow squalls will remain over the area throughout the day. An additional 10 to 15 cm can be expected before the squalls taper off to flurries late this afternoon. ### Rapidly accumulating snow could make travel difficult over some locations. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2021-01-30T04:59:31-00:00

properties.Title: Blowing Snow Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Poor visibility in snow and blowing snow is expected or occurring in some locations. Total snowfall: near 10 cm. Maximum wind gusts: northwest to north 70 km/h. Locations: Hopedale and vicinity. Time span: tonight until Saturday evening. Remarks: Fresh snowfall will combine with strengthening northwesterly winds tonight to give poor visibility in blowing snow, which will persist through Saturday. The snow will taper off Saturday evening and winds will subside Saturday night. ### Travel is expected to be hazardous due to reduced visibility. Blowing snow advisories are issued when winds are expected to create blowing snow giving poor visibility to 800 metres or less for at least 3 hours. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2021-01-30T06:34:30-00:00
